result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R T Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Case 15CF1209 was dismissed and read in. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a GED or HSED. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R T Jordan

defendant.name: Jordan, Steven R T
defendant.address: 6134 N River Trail Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 03/25/16 plea/sentencing.
3 character letters filed by Attorney Coffee
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven R T Jordan in court, in custody, with Attorney Rebecca M Coffee.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Coffee makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

6  YEARS IMPRISONMENT    **CONCURRENT**
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling- obtain HSED or GED 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BUY MONEY:  $820.00 to Metro Drug Unit  (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($5,000.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder to be returned to poster)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional Institution.
Plea hearing at 03-25-2016 11:00 am

Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court.   Defendant Steven R T Jordan did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Coffee states that Defendant is in custody in Milwaukee County.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee County jail.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-28-2016 02:00 pm
Motion hearing at 12-04-2015 03:30 pm
to Disclose confidential informant

Defendant Steven R T Jordan in court with Attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Coffee files motion (Motion to disclose confidential informant).  Court schedules motion.    Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing at 10-26-2015 10:00 am
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Steven R T Jordan in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant must comply with Justice Point as ordered in Milwaukee County case.

Defendant Steven R T Jordan in court, in custody, with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
